item.title: V Rising: Weapon Coating Guide
item.description:
In V Rising , combat becomes more tactical with the introduction of Weapon Coatings in the 1.1 update. Weapon Coatings are consumables that imbue their next primary attack with one of six elemental effects.

V Rising players can apply coatings to multiple weapons and switch between them to adapt to different combat situations. Here's a breakdown of what each coating does and how to use them effectively.

What Are Weapon Coatings in V Rising

Each Weapon Coating has a 15-second personal cooldown, while all coatings share a 5-second global cooldown, making weapon-swapping viable but timing-sensitive. Weapon Coatings in V Rising offer powerful burst effects and tactical utility.

There are six types of Weapon Coatings that players can craft using the Alchemy Table. The Alchemy Table blueprint is unlocked by defeating Clive the Firestarter in Act 1 of the game. Clive is level 30, so make sure to have strong gear and weapons to take him on.

How to Get Weapon Coatings in V Rising

Once players build an Alchemy Table, they still need to beat another V Blood Carrier called Stavros the Carver (level 75) to get the Weapon Coatings recipes. The following ingredients are needed to craft Weapon Coatings:

  • Corrupted Flower
  • Venom Sap

Whether they're facing enemy mobs or rival vampires, mastering elemental rotations gives players a deadly edge.

All Weapon Coatings and Their Effects in V Rising

Weapon Coating

Effect

Blood Coating

The next main attack inflicts Leech and Vampiric Curse, dealing 40% magic damage after 2s and spawning a Blood Orb.

Chaos Coating

The next main attack triggers a Chaos Explosion, dealing 50% magic damage in an area and inflicting Ignite.

Unholy Coating

The next main attack deals 40% bonus magic damage, inflicts Condemn, and conjures a bone spirit that circles the target, dealing 50% damage and inflicting Condemn to any enemy it hits.

Illusion Coating

The next main attack triggers an Energy Burst, dealing 30% magic damage in an area, inflicting Weaken and granting 4 stacks of Phantasm.

Frost Coating

The next main attack triggers a Frost Nova, dealing 30% magic damage in an area and inflicting Chill.

Storm Coating

The next main attack deals 40% bonus magic damage and triggers Chain Lightning.

How to Use Weapon Coatings in V Rising

Trips and Tricks to Mastering the Consumable

Open fights with Chaos or Frost Coating to soften enemies or control movement before switching to high-damage or sustain effects. Chaos deals immediate area damage and applies a burn effect, making it ideal for initiating a skirmish or interrupting enemy spellcasting.

Cycle weapons strategically; always have 2–3 with different coatings and manage the short global cooldown to maintain pressure without overlap.

Frost, on the other hand, slows enemy movement with Chill, creating opportunities to kite, disengage, or set up stronger follow-up attacks. Use Blood Coating during longer engagements to heal through Leech and pick up Blood Orbs for added survivability. It's particularly effective for melee builds who need to stay in close and mitigate damage.

Unholy and Storm Coatings are ideal for groups, providing bouncing or persistent AoE effects that can disrupt clustered enemies. These coatings shine when enemies are grouped, allowing players to disrupt and control the battlefield while dishing out high magic damage.

Your comment has not been saved

V Rising
9.0 /10
Released
May 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

item.title: Stardew Valley: How To Get All Mastery Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Unlocking The Mastery Cave
  • Mastery Points, Explained
  • Gaining Mastery Points
  • Unlocking Mastery Rewards
    • Farming Mastery Rewards
    • Mining Mastery Rewards
    • Foraging Mastery Rewards
    • Fishing Mastery Rewards
    • Combat Mastery Rewards

With the 1.6 update of Stardew Valley , a Mastery system was introduced, allowing players to master the game's five fundamental skills: Farming, Mining, Foraging, Fishing, and Combat. By earning experience points in these skills, players can enter the Mastery Cave and claim all five masteries with Grandpa's guidance.

Players have embraced this update and the accompanying rewards as an exciting addition to the endgame of Stardew Valley . However, achieving mastery in all five skills can be a challenging task, requiring significant time and effort to accumulate the necessary experience points. Here's everything players need to know about getting all the available Mastery rewards.

Unlocking The Mastery Cave

Where It Is And How To Get In

The Mastery Cave is located in Cindersap Forest, above and to the right of the area where Spring Onions spawn and the Trash Bear appears. If players interact with the door before gaining access, they will be presented with the following text: "Only a master of the five ways may enter (X/5)." X represents the number of skills in which the player has reached level 10.

Players will need to reach level 10 in all skills (Farming, Mining, Foraging, Fishing, and Combat) before they can enter the cave. Inside, there is a note in the bottom right corner from the player's Grandpa that reads:

"My dear *Player Name*,

If you're reading this note, you've found the secret room I've prepared for you. Within these walls are tips, recipes, and even some of my most cherished tools... all the very best from the many happy years I spent in the valley.

By coming this far, you'll have proven that you possess the skill and wisdom to make good use of these powerful secrets. I hope my discoveries help you in your journey to making *Player's Farm Name* a shining star of the whole world!

Make me proud!

—Grandpa"

Mastery Points, Explained

What They Are And How To Use Them

Mastery Points are essentially experience points (XP) that players earn after reaching level 10 in each skill. They serve as the currency needed to unlock various mastery levels, with a total of 100,000 points required to master all skills. Each of the five mastery levels demands a specific number of Mastery Points to be reached:

  • Level 1: 10,000
  • Level 2: 15,000
  • Level 3: 20,000
  • Level 4: 25,000
  • Level 5: 30,000

At each new level unlocked, players will see an on-screen message that reads, "You've reached a new level of understanding..." This message indicates that a new level of Mastery has been achieved. Once players receive this message, they can go to the Mastery Cave to choose which of the five available masteries to claim, with each offering different rewards.

Players can track their Mastery Points in the Skills tab and view their selected Masteries in the Special Items & Powers tab of the character menu.

Gaining Mastery Points

How To Earn Mastery Points

Activities that earn Mastery Points include:

  • Farming: Harvesting crops and caring for animals.
  • Mining: Breaking rocks.
  • Foraging: Gathering foraged goods and chopping wood.
  • Fishing: Catching fish with a Fishing Rod or in a Crab Pot .
  • Combat: Fighting monsters.
  • Reading Books.

Unlocking Mastery Rewards

Available RewardsAnd Their Uses

Inside the Mastery Cave, five pillars stand, each representing a skill in Stardew Valley . Players can view the rewards for mastering each skill at any point by interacting with these pillars. As players unlock each mastery level, they can choose one of the pillars to receive mastery rewards from that skill.

Farming Mastery Rewards

  • Iridium Scythe : Harvests crops and has a 100% chance of gathering Hay from Grass.
  • Statue Of Blessings Recipe: Crafting plans for a statue that grants the player a different blessing each day.
  • Golden Animal Cracker : Unlocks the ability to find Golden Animal Crackers.

Mining Mastery Rewards

  • Statue Of The Dwarf King Recipe: Crafting recipe for a statue that grants the player one mining power per day.
  • Heavy Furnace Recipe: Crafting recipe for a more convenient Furnace.
  • Double Gem Production: All broken gem rocks will produce double the amount of gems.

Foraging Mastery Rewards

  • Mystic Tree Seed Recipe: Crafting recipe for a seed that grows into a Mystic Tree.
  • Treasure Totem Recipe: Crafting recipe for a totem that grants the player 16 Artifact Spots per use.
  • Golden Mystery Box : Unlocks the ability to find Golden Mystery Boxes.

Fishing Mastery Rewards

  • Advanced Iridium Rod : An upgraded fishing rod that has two Tackle slots.
  • Challenge Bait Recipe: Crafting recipe for bait that allows triple the amount of fish per catch.
  • Golden Fishing Treasure Chests: Unlocks the ability to find Golden Fishing Treasure Chests when catching fish.

Combat Mastery Rewards

  • Anvil Recipe: Crafting recipe for a tool that allows players to re-forge Trinkets.
  • Mini-Forge Recipe: Crafting recipe for a portable dwarvish forge from the Volcano.
  • Trinkets: Unlocks the ability to find Trinkets.

item.title: Phasmophobia Releases New Update for May 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Phasmophobia has released a new hotfix patch, addressing gameplay bugs and UI issues for a smoother experience.
  • The update prevents players from placing equipment on Jackalope nest eggs and allows the Obake ghost to shapeshift during events.
  • Despite fixes, lighting glitches may still occur, but future updates promise major improvements and new content.

Phasmophobia has pushed out a new update for May 2025, fixing several bugs that players had reported. This Phasmophobia patch doesn't include a lot of new content, but it makes the game run more smoothly and addresses recent issues.

Phasmophobia is a horror title where players take on the role of ghost hunters. They explore haunted places, collect evidence of paranormal activity, and try to stay alive. The game came out in early access in September 2020 and has done well, selling over 20 million copies just on PC. Four years later, it came to consoles too, launching on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S right before Halloween 2024. A big part of Phasmophobia ’s success is thanks to the steady stream of updates from Kinetic Games, who keeps improving and adding to the game to make sure it stays fresh and enjoyable.

Kinetic Games has released a new hotfix update, version 0.12.1.1, to resolve problems that showed up after the start of Phasmophobia ’s Cursed Hollow event. This patch includes a few key adjustments, such as preventing players from placing equipment on Jackalope nest eggs, which now behave consistently with the nests themselves. It also updated the Obake ghost model to allow shapeshifting during seasonal events where it is replaced by an event ghost model.

The patch also fixes a bunch of bugs that were affecting gameplay and the user interface. For example, the audio now plays properly when opening the Cursed Hollow leaflet in the warehouse, and map voting works like it’s supposed to, with vote tapes going back to their original spots after a map is deselected. There were also some visual and performance problems that got fixed, like missing terrain textures on the Point Hope map, issues with DOTS T2 when Phasmophobia 's ghosts are nearby, and gamepad sensitivity glitches that came from recent changes to the deadzone settings. One important fix is for VR players: ghosts can now kill them again, restoring a key part of the gameplay.

That said, not everything’s perfect yet. The developers say that lighting glitches might still happen on some maps while the event is live, and they are keeping an eye on that. As for what’s coming next, Kinetic Games recently shared a roadmap for 2025 and beyond. Players can expect to see some major updates, revamped maps, and more seasonal content. To top it off, Phasmophobia just passed a big milestone with over 3 million copies sold on PlayStation, PS VR2, and Xbox Series X/S.

Phasmophobia Cursed Hollow - Hotfix v0.12.1.1 Path Notes

Changes

  • You can no longer "place" equipment on Jackalope nest eggs, which is now consistent with the nest itself.
  • Obake ghost model can now shape shift during seasonal events where the model is replaced with an event ghost model.

Fixes

  • Fixed an issue that caused no audio to play when opening the Cursed Hollow leaflet in the warehouse.
  • Fixed an issue that caused the player’s vote tape to not return to its original point after deselecting a map.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented the lobby volume not adjusting when using the slider in Audio settings.
  • Fixed an issue that caused different daily and weekly challenges to appear from player to player as well as rotational maps.
  • Fixed an issue that caused inconsistencies with DOTS T2 when the ghost and Forest Minions were too close to the player.
  • Fixed an issue that removed textures from Point Hope’s terrain.
  • Fixed an issue introduced with the gamepad deadzone change that caused changes to player’s sensitivity settings.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented the ghost from killing a player when playing in VR.
  • Fixed an issue that gave the incorrect name to the Cursed Hollow event badge.

Known Issues

  • Players may encounter lighting issues across various maps during the event period.

item.title: 8 Best Final Fantasy Games From The 2000s, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Final Fantasy franchise has seen quality games post 2000 merger, with some titles making a huge impact even today.
  • Final Fantasy 13 was groundbreaking, despite divisive opinion, mainly due to the rewarding gameplay post-linearity.
  • Final Fantasy Tactics stands out for its challenging tactical combat and enhanced PSP version that still holds up well.

Final Fantasy 's history in the gaming industry is legendary, with fans being graced by some incredible titles that are in a class of their own. From amazing turn-based games to admirable attempts at replicating real-time combat, the franchise has seen it all and then some.

With the SquareSoft and Enix merger being cemented in the early 2000s, the company devoted extra resources to developing a wave of quality Final Fantasy games, spinoffs, and remakes, among other things. The best ones of the bunch made a huge splash around twenty years ago and are still talked about fondly by fans to this day.

8 Final Fantasy 13

The Most Divisive Game In The Series

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 13
6 /10
7.3 /10
Released
March 9, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

The strong emotions caused by the mere mention of Final Fantasy 13 make it clear that this title made a major impact back when it launched. It was the first title in the series to be launched on the Xbox, which was already major news back in the day.

While the weird story, confusing jargon, divisive character writing, and a focus on linearity didn't sit right with many, Final Fantasy 13 rewarded players for sticking with it in the long run. The game feels amazing once players reach Gran Pulse, allowing them to finally change their party makeup and explore the world freely instead of having their hand held throughout the experience.

7 Final Fantasy 10-2

A Bombastic And Energetic Sequel That Continues Yuna's Adventures

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy X-2
10.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Square Product Development Division 1
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3, PS4, PS Vita, Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

Final Fantasy 10-2 is the sequel no one wanted, especially given how beautiful the predecessor's ending was. However, once fans got their hands on this title, they were elated to see just how engaging the combat system was.

Any Final Fantasy game with a robust job system is bound to excite the masses, and Final Fantasy 10-2 didn't disappoint in this regard. Players could switch dresspheres on the fly and employ techniques to smash their enemies with ease.

6 Dissidia Final Fantasy

The Spinoff Fighting Game That Had No Business Being So Good

Your comment has not been saved

Dissidia Final Fantasy
8.7 /10
Released
August 25, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PSP
Powered by

No one expected Dissidia Final Fantasy to establish itself as one of the greatest Final Fantasy games fans could enjoy on the PSP. This game brings the heroes and villains of multiple Final Fantasy games together in an epic struggle between Chaos and Cosmos.

Players must improve their skills and masterfully balance Bravery and HP attacks to take out their opponent in style. Fights become really tough later on, urging players to master defensive moves instead of staying on the offense all the time.

5 Final Fantasy 12

Boasts An Epic Story Full Of Political Intrigue

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 12
8.8 /10
Released
October 31, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS4, PS2, Xbox One, Switch, PC
Powered by

Final Fantasy 12 's epic story will enrapture fans in no time. Even if Vaan may not be the best protagonist in the series, the game almost structures itself as an ensemble cast and gives everyone the time to shine.

The focus on hunts coupled with the grand narrative made Final Fantasy 12 one of the best games on the PS2. The Gambit system was somewhat worth mastering if players wanted to micromanage every action that their AI-controlled party members performed in combat.

4 Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7

A Prequel With Amazing Real-Time Combat And An Emotional Story

Your comment has not been saved

Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7
Action RPG
Systems
Released
March 24, 2008
ESRB
Teen // Blood, Mild Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix

Platform(s)
PlayStation Portable
Powered by

Crisis Core is an amazing Final Fantasy game that had no business being so compelling. Fans accusing this title of being yet another attempt to cash in on Final Fantasy 7 's allure swallowed their words after seeing just how incredible this adventure was.

Zack Fair is a lovable protagonist who is deeply loyal to his friends, which leads to a tragic ending that will make fans tear up. It also explores Cloud's backstory and the events leading to his memories being addled before the events of Final Fantasy 7 .

3 Final Fantasy 9

A Charming Mix Of Old And New Final Fantasy

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 9
14
9.6 /10
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PS1, Android, iOS, PC
Powered by

One of the most charming Final Fantasy games fans can get their hands on, the ninth mainline entry boasts some of the best Final Fantasy party members of all time. Characters like Zidane, Garnet, Steiner, Vivi, and Eiko will have a strong impact on fans who love the charming translation of this game.

From enacting theatrical battles to fighting for the fate of the world, Final Fantasy 9 constantly wows fans by paying respect to the series' roots. It may be less spectacular than the titles that preceded it, but that should take nothing away from the sheer quality oozing out of every pore in Final Fantasy 9 .

2 Final Fantasy Tactics: The War Of The Lions

An Updated Version Of One Of The Best Strategy Video Games

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy Tactics: The War of the Lions
10.0 /10
Released
May 10, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Square Enix, Tose
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PSP
Powered by

It's a testament to the quality of Final Fantasy Tactics that it still held up when it received an enhanced release on the PSP. The tactical combat is quite challenging but worth powering through once fans understand how to make the most of a bad situation.

Mastering jobs and leveling up is a must for players who don't want to be decimated by the various infamous difficulty spikes in the game. Thankfully, the amazing story more than makes up for its drawbacks and ensures that fans will have a great time with Final Fantasy Tactics when they're done with this adventure.

1 Final Fantasy 10

Arguably The Best Title In The Series

5 Images
5 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 10
19
9.7 /10
Released
December 17, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS2
Powered by

To this day, many fans swear by the fact that Final Fantasy 10 is the peak of this series. This is hefty praise that is justified when fans check out this title and see just how ahead of its time the game was in the context of JRPGs.

Smooth party-switching, a Sphere Grid that looked complicated but was deceptively simple, and a story for the ages elevated Final Fantasy 10 to legendary status. Despite being a bit too overbearing at the start, fans will shed tears for Tidus and appreciate his dogged nature by the time this game draws to a close.

item.title: Mass Effect: 9 Best Friendships In The Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Joker and EDI's banter evolves into a solid friendship.
  • Suvi and Kallo run the Tempest flawlessly and share a wholesome bond.
  • Garrus and Tali are a strong, platonic pair, showcasing deep friendship and potential romance.

Mass Effect is one of the best sci-fi space RPG series out there, especially the original Shepard trilogy involving a galactic war against the terrifying sentient alien machines known very aptly as the Reapers. Then there's Andromeda , a title that took gamers beyond the Milky Way and into the far reaches of the eponymous galaxy, allowing for some exciting new planets and aliens.

With all these new places to explore and people to meet, not to mention the danger everyone is flung into on a daily basis, it is only natural that those in close quarters with one another get to chatting and even become friends. There are many platonic pairings in the universe of Mass Effect, but these are the absolute best.

9 James Vega and Steve Cortez

Their Bromance is Nothing Short of Hilarious

Mass Effect 3 brought in new faces, with James Vega and Steve Cortez being two of the best among them. Both men can be seen hanging around in the hangar, and as one might expect, a rapport is built between the two. Most of the time, Shepard enters to catch them mid-conversation, which normally involves them harmlessly poking fun at each other.

Both give as good as they get, which makes each of their conversations hilarious. The Citadel DLC further shows how good the two friends are when they turn up to Shepard's apartment to watch sports in their new fancy pad, engaging in even more banter that never becomes tiring to hear.

8 Joker and Edi

Joker Eventually Warms Up to EDI's Presence

Mass Effect 2 introduces co-pilot EDI, an AI assistant to Joker, which the proud pilot of the Normandy is none too pleased about. Joker obviously has very little love towards EDI, but as time goes on, he warms up to her presence and even values the help she can provide for his excellent piloting skills. The two often bicker like an old married couple, which can be very amusing to watch.

Joker liked EDI even more in Mass Effect 3 when she upgrades to a conventionally attractive robot body, becoming all too happy to have her close by. The two can even enter into a romance, as EDI learns all about love and friendship from both Shepard and Joker. Players can discourage this romance from going forward if they prefer, but thankfully, the development of a romantic relationship doesn't dissolve the friendship between the pair.

7 Suvi Anwar and Kallo Jath

The Two Work More Than Well Together Aboard the Tempest

The Tempest would not quite be the same without Suvi Anwar and Kallo Jath at the helm. These two keep the ship running, and such an important task requires stringent teamwork. As luck would have it, Kallo and Suvi are perfectly amicable with one another.

One could easily go as far as to call them friends, which is how Kallo himself describes the relationship between the two. Almost like Andromeda 's version of Joker and Edi, Suvi and Kallo's friendship is pure, wholesome, and maintains a humor that could rival theirs. As far as the companions in Andromeda go, Suvi and Kallo's dynamic is one of the strongest in the entire series.

6 Garrus Vakarian and Tali'Zorah

These Two Companions Are Fast Friends and Can Potentially Become Something More

Of course, Shepard isn't the only one making friends or flirting with companions aboard the Normandy, as there are many other friendships and even a few romances that can blossom if Shepard elects not to woo certain characters. Two of the characters in question are Garrus and Tali'Zorah, who are both fond friends of Shepard and potential romance options, depending on the chosen gender of the player character.

By the time Mass Effect 3 rolls around, the two are thick as thieves, hanging around together during downtime on the Normandy, and they can even be interrupted while they are becoming more than friends closer to the end of the third game if neither are romanced. Though they are a sweet couple, they also make excellent friends.

5 Kaidan Alenko and Ashley Williams

The Two Alliance Soldiers Naturally Gravitate Towards One Another

The friendship between Kaidan and Ashley burns bright and quickly, as one of them inevitably dies without the intervention of a mod that allows players to save them both. Players more often than not push the Virmire mission as far back as possible if they know, because they will be forced to decide between which companion they want to save during it.

Before one of them unfortunately dies on this infamous mission, players can listen to some of the dialogue between the pair if they choose to bring them along on adventures, which does show a budding friendship between the two. It is evident that, if both had survived, they would have no doubt been the best of friends..

4 Commander Shepard and Joker

The Wise-Cracking Pilot Never Loses Faith in Commander Shepard

Joker is one of the few characters who remains as a member of the Normandy crew in every game, mostly out of loyalty to Commander Shepard and to do what he does best: pilot a spaceship. While Shepard's resurrection in Mass Effect 2 combined with their new allegiance to Cerberus had others raising their eyebrows in suspicion, Joker was still there, ready to stick with them through thick and thin.

His good sense of humor and heart of gold endeared many fans to his character, making him a likable figure among players and even in-game. Shepard can roll their eyes all they want, but it is clear they care a lot about Joker, and their friendship is one that was never shaken, even after their death at the start of the second game. The fact that Shepard sacrificed themselves to launch Joker's escape pod to safety only further proves the strength of their bond.

3 Commander Shepard and Garrus Vakarian

There's No Shepard Without Vakarian

By far, one of the best companions a player could ever hope for in a game is Garrus Vakarian. His growth throughout the series is the best among Shepard's allies, his romance is one of the most popular (for good reason), and he remains as one of Shepard's closest friends in the series.

Though at first there is an air of distrust between the two, eventually respect fosters into a friendship, a relationship that carries throughout the trilogy. He rejoins Shepard in both Mass Effect 2 and Mass Effect 3, trusting that they are doing the right thing and being ready to save the galaxy right at their side. The very end of Mass Effect 3 before the final push shows just how close the two are with the very touching quote "There is no Shepard without Vakarian," which in itself is a summary of their unshakable bond.

2 Liara T'Soni and Commander Shepard

Liara Did Everything She Could to Resurrect Shepard

Though there are no canon choices in Mass Effect , as everyone's playthrough will differ, Liara T'Soni is often posited as the main romance choice, as even just casually asking her more about herself in the first game leads players down the path to romance. Furthermore, out of all of Shepard's friends, Liara is the one who decides to do the impossible by bringing Shepard back to life after their untimely death at the start of Mass Effect 2 .

This is proof that, even if the player chose not to romance her, Liara still cares very deeply about Shepard, even resorting to the desperate measure of reaching out to Cerberus in order to bring her friend back from death, which is how she justifies her actions if questioned. Liara is one of the kinder characters in Mass Effect , even after taking up the mantle of the Shadow Broker, which makes her one of the best friends Shepard could hope for.

1 David Anderson and Commander Shepard

The Father Figure That Was Needed

Shepard is a popular person, but this comes with being the main character. In a way, they are also the gel that holds the entire galaxy together in the face of the reaper threat. As such, one cannot begin to mention all the strong bonds and friendships Shepard has fostered over the years without mentioning Captain David Anderson.

He is a sort of father figure and mentor to Shepard, always ready to offer advice or help as and when it is needed. He is also willing to risk quite a bit in order to help Shepard succeed, such as breaking into Udina's office and punching the Councilor out cold in order to free the Normandy from the Citadel. He joins Shepard and co. for the final fight, and right before he dies, the two share a touching conversation, in which he admits how proud he is of Shepard and all they have done. It is impossible for many to sit through that scene without shedding a tear for one of Shepard's fondest friends.
